main_definition: To establish or set up (a business, institution, etc.) as the origin or starting point.

meanings_and_examples.example: In 1976, Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak founded Apple Inc., which became one of the world's leading technology companies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Establishing an idea, principle, or belief as a foundation
meanings_and_examples.example: The concept of human rights was founded on the principles of equality and dignity for all individuals.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To base one's opinion or judgment upon a solid basis
meanings_and_examples.example: His argument is founded on years of research and data analysis, making it compelling to his audience.
